blacksquare.cell module¶

class blacksquare.cell.Cell(parent_crossword: Crossword, index: CellIndex, value: CellValue = SpecialCellValue.EMPTY)¶

Bases: object

An object representing a single cell in the crossword. Should not be constructed by the user.

blacksquare.crossword module¶

class blacksquare.crossword.Crossword(num_rows: typing.Optional[int] = None, num_cols: typing.Optional[int] = None, grid: typing.Optional[typing.Union[typing.List[typing.List[str]], numpy.ndarray]] = None, word_list: blacksquare.word_list.WordList = WordList(                     word  score 0            ACCENTCOACH    1.0 1               AKNOCKIN    1.0 2           APEXPREDATOR    1.0 3            AREYOUDRUNK    1.0 4          ARTISTICNUDES    1.0 ...                  ...    ... 566655        VANDECAMPS    0.0 566656           VERVAIN    0.0 566657  WOLLAWSYOURPRIDE    0.0 566658       WYNONARYDER    0.0 566659         YODASPEAK    0.0  [566660 rows x 2 columns] ), display_size_px: int = 450)¶

An object representing a crossword puzzle.

find_area_solutions(seed_word_index: Tuple[blacksquare.types.Direction, int], word_list: Optional[blacksquare.word_list.WordList] = None) → List[blacksquare.crossword.Crossword]¶

A method to solve entire contiguous areas of the crossword, starting from a seed.

Parameters

  • seed_word_index (WordIndex) – The word to start from.

  • word_list (Optional[WordList], optional) – The word list to use. If None, the default word list for the crossword will be use.

Returns

A list of solutions, ranked by score.

Return type

List[Crossword]

find_solutions(word_indices: List[Tuple[blacksquare.types.Direction, int]], word_list: Optional[blacksquare.word_list.WordList] = None, beam_width=100) → List[blacksquare.crossword.Crossword]¶

Finds solutions for the provided words. Solutions are returned as new crossword objects.

Parameters

  • word_indices (List[WordIndex]) – The words to consider.

  • word_list (Optional[WordList], optional) – The word list to use. If None, the default word list for the crossword will be use.

  • beam_width (int, optional) – Search parameter, how many branches to consider. Defaults to 100.

Returns

A list of solutions, ranked by score.

Return type

List[Crossword]

get_symmetric_word(word_index: Tuple[blacksquare.types.Direction, int]) → blacksquare.word.Word¶
get_word_at_index(index: Tuple[int, int], direction: blacksquare.types.Direction) → Optional[blacksquare.word.Word]¶

Gets the word that passes through a cell in a given direction.

Parameters

  • index (CellIndex) – The index of the cell.

  • direction (Direction) – The direction of the word.

Returns

The word passing through the index in the provided direction. If the index corresponds to a black square, this method returns None.

Return type

Optional[Word]

get_word_cells(word_index: Tuple[blacksquare.types.Direction, int]) → List[blacksquare.cell.Cell]¶
itercells() → Iterator[blacksquare.cell.Cell]¶

Method for iterating over the cells in the crossword.

Yields

Iterator[Cell] – An iterator of Cell objects. Ordered left to right, top to bottom.

iterwords(direction: Optional[blacksquare.types.Direction] = None) → Iterator[blacksquare.word.Word]¶

Method for iterating over the words in the crossword.

Parameters

direction (Direction, optional) – If provided, limits the iterator to only the given direction.

Yields

Iterator[Word] – An iterator of Word objects. Ordered in standard crossword fashion (ascending numbers, across then down).

pprint(numbers: bool = False) → str¶

Prints a formatted string representation of the crossword fill.

Parameters

numbers (bool) – If True, prints the numbers in the grid rather than the letters. Defaults to False.

set_cell(index: Tuple[int, int], value: str, inplace: bool = True) → Optional[blacksquare.crossword.Crossword]¶

Sets a cell to a new value. If inpace is set to False, returns a new Crossword object rather than modifying the current one.

Parameters

  • index (CellIndex) – The index of the cell.

  • value (str) – The new value of the cell.

  • inplace (bool) – Whether to modify the current object.

Returns

If inplace is False, a new Crossword object is returned with new value.

Return type

Optional[Crossword]

set_word(word_index: Tuple[blacksquare.types.Direction, int], value: str, inplace: bool = True) → Optional[blacksquare.crossword.Crossword]¶

Sets a word to a new value. If inplace is set to False, returns a new Crossword object rather than modifying the current one.

Parameters

  • word_index (WordIndex) – The index of the word.

  • value (str) – The new value of the word.

  • inplace (bool) – Whether to modify the current object.

Returns

If inplace is False, a new Crossword object is returned with new value.

Return type

Optional[Crossword]

to_pdf(filename: str, header: Optional[List[str]] = None) → None¶

Outputs a .pdf file in NYT submission format from the Crossword object.

Parameters

  • filename (str) – The output path.

  • header (List[str], optional) – A list of strings to put on the output (e.g. name, address, etc.). Each list element will be one line in the header.

A utility function to perform grouped summing of values over numpy arrays.

  • values (np.ndarray) – An array of values.

blacksquare.word module¶

class blacksquare.word.Word(parent_crossword: Crossword, direction: Direction, number: int, clue: str = '')¶

find_matches(word_list: Optional[WordList] = None) → MatchWordList¶

Finds matches for the word, ranking matches by how many valid crosses they allow.

Parameters

  • word_list (Optional[WordList], optional) – The word list to use for matching.

  • None (If) –

  • used.. (the default wordlist of the parent crossword is) –

Returns

The matching words, scored by compatible crosses.

Return type

MatchWordList

blacksquare.word_list module¶

class blacksquare.word_list.MatchWordList(word_length: int, words: numpy.ndarray, scores: numpy.ndarray)¶

Bases: blacksquare.word_list.WordList

An object representing a WordList matching an open word. This class should not be constructed by the user, it is generated by matching methods on the original word list.

letter_scores_at_index(index: int) → Dict[str, int]¶

The summed scores of matching letters at a given index.

Parameters

index (int) – The index to look at.

Returns

A dict mapping letters to the summed scores of words containing that letter at the input index

Return type

Dict[str, int]

rescore(rescore_fn: Callable[[str], float], drop_zeros=True) → blacksquare.word_list.MatchWordList¶

Generates a new word list with new scores, as defined by the rescore function.

Parameters

  • rescore_fn (Callable[[str], float]) – The function mapping words to new scores. This function should treat zero as invalid.

  • drop_zeros (bool, optional) – Whether to remove words with a score of zero. Defaults to True.

Returns

A match word list where new scores are the results of the

rescore function times the original score for the word.

Return type

MatchWordList

class blacksquare.word_list.WordList(source: Union[str, pathlib.Path, io.IOBase, List[str], Dict[str, Union[int, float]]])¶

find_matches_str(query: str) → blacksquare.word_list.MatchWordList¶

Find matches for a query string. Open letters can be represented by a ” “, “?”, or “_” character.

Parameters

query (str) – The string to match against (e.g. “M???ING”)

Returns

A MatchWordList object containing the matching words.

Return type

MatchWordList
